properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and torrential rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-16T05:56:51-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values will reach 38 over parts of southern Manitoba today. Humidex values will lower overnight after a cold front tracks through the area. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-16T07:32:10-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. A line of strong thunderstorms from Berens River to Hecla Island is capable of producing gusts in excess of 90 km/h and nickel-sized hail. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T18:34:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T14:10:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1565466817.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms today. Thunderstorms over Northwestern Ontario will continue moving east. Strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain are all possible with these thunderstorms. There is also the risk of a tornado. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid weather will begin today and likely last into the weekend. Daytime high temperatures will be in the low to mid thirties with Humidex values at times approaching the low to mid forties. Overnight lows will remain in the low to mid twenties, offering little relief from the heat. Showers and thunderstorms on Tuesday and Wednesday may keep daytime high temperatures slightly cooler than the warning criteria. However the hot and humid air mass will remain in the place until the weekend. A cooler air mass may arrive by next Monday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-16T07:33:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T15:34:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2118757836.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Thunderstorms have developed in the area and are expected to continue today. Some of these storms may become severe. Total rainfall amounts of 75 mm or more are possible for a few locales. The possibility of severe thunderstorms will continue through the afternoon and possibly into the evening. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid airmass continues to affect parts of Northwestern Ontario today. Daytime high temperatures will be near 29 degrees with humidex values near or above 36. Overnight low temperatures will remain near or above 18 degrees, which will not provide much relief from the heat. The hot condition may continue for areas near the Minnesota border on Tuesday. Cooler air is expected Tuesday night. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-16T06:59:00-00:00

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and early this evening. Strong wind gusts of 110 km/h, large hail up to 5 cm and heavy rain are all possible along with the risk of tornadoes. ### Tornado watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce tornadoes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:48 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A large area of thunderstorms is moving east at 60 km/h over the area. Wind gusts near 90 km/h are expected along with locally heavy heavy rain in excess of 50 mm. Locations impacted by these thunderstorms include Poplar Hill, Pikangikum, Sandy Lake and MacDowell. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-15T19:15:31-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:54 p.m. CDT (12:54 p.m. EST, 1:54 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Several areas of thunderstorms continue to move east at 60 km/h over an area from Pikangikum to Summer Beaver. Wind gusts near 90 km/h are expected along with locally heavy heavy rain in excess of 75 mm for areas that receive multiple thunderstorms. Locations impacted include: Poplar Hill, Pikangikum, MacDowell, Cat Lake, Pipestone River Provincial Park, Casummit Lake and Summer Beaver. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. Southerly winds are pushing smoke into the community of High Level causing pour air quality. The winds are expected to remain light or from the south over the next 24 to 36 hours. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-16T08:32:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-07-15T16:33:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583349446.2019

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area. A line of thunderstorms over southeastern portions of Lake of the Woods is moving east at around 25 knots. Wind gusts near 45 knots are expected to accompany these thunderstorms as they move over Lake of the Woods. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-07-15T20:28:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T17:43:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1548522828.2019
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:00 a.m. CDT (11:00 a.m. EST, 12:00 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A large area of thunderstorms is moving east at 60 km/h. Wind gusts near 90 km/h are expected along with locally heavy heavy rain in excess of 50 mm. Locations impacted include: Cat Lake, Pipestone River Provincial Park and Summer Beaver. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-15T19:50:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T16:01:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0840707436.2019
Area: Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
